Name: Forced Kratos Reaction
Flavor (Project): If the antikratos equations are subduing the Titans, maybe we can find a way to reverse the process and stimulate a kratos reaction
Flavor (Tech): Is it pain or elation?
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan may gain +1 @Rage

Name: Teleresuscitation
Flavor (Project): The philosophers of the Last Academy are sure they found a way to stimulate an almost preternatural survival instinct
Flavor (Tech): A Titan springs back to their feet as if Hades himself compelled them
Abilities: Choose a knocked down Titan. That Titan stands up

Name: Fate Sink
Flavor (Project): By exerting force on the Triskelion Junction, we are able to ever so slightly alter the course of Fate itself
Flavor (Tech): Whose life have we inrrevocably changed?
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan may lose -1 @Fate

Name: Arrow Barrage
Flavor (Project): Reinforced spear and arrow tips, as well as synchronocity training, allows ship-stationed warriors to slightly weaken the AT field of a Primordial
Flavor (Tech): Ready volley!
Abilities: Place 1 Break token or 2 Opening tokens in the Kratos Pool

Name: Crisis Protocol
Flavor (Project): The fallen priests have uncovered a surprising Gaia connection. Through the Triskelion Junction, we may be able to stimulate some form of spontaneous healing
Flavor (Tech): A new philsophical protocol allow sus to tap into the lingering lifeforce of Gaia and re-direct it to or from a Titan
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan may gain or lose 2 @Danger

Name: Pursuer Protocol
Flavor (Project): The academicians studied the Pursuer's reflex pattern and are certain they can duplicate it in the Triskelion Junction
Flavor (Tech): Analysis of the Hermesian Pursuer's reflexes and the 'shadow' it casts on the Triskelion Junction enables us to momentarily boost a Titan's reaction time
Abilities: <Reaction> Choose a Titan. That Titan may move 1 space

Name: Trireme Ballista Fire
Flavor (Project): Mere arrows and javelins are not enough to pierce the thick armor of the Spartan Primordials. We need concentrated ballista fire
Leads To: Cyclonus Sighting, Temenos Advanced Gear, Reflex Priming
Flavor (Tech): A well timed bolt can turn the tide of battle
Abilities: Choose a Titan performing a Power Roll. That Titan gains {Power Re-roll 1}

Name: Triskelion Power Boost
Flavor (Project): There is some latent power in the Balaneion itself, power we can temporarily transfer through the junction
Leads To: Temenos Advanced Gear, Chimera Metastasios Sighting, Forced Kratos Cooldown
Flavor (Tech): Is this Us exerting our strength, or something else entirely?
Abilities: Choose an attacking Titan. That Titan gains {Pushback 2}

Name: Forced Kratos Cooldown
Flavor (Project): We can flood the Junction with soothing thoughts, temporarily subduing even the most violent tendencies
Flavor (Tech): Can you hear me now?
Abilities: Choose a Titan that is about to gain involuntary @Rage to ignore that gain.; Choose a Titan. That Titan loses -1 @Rage

Name: Reflex Priming
Flavor (Project): By slightly increasing the autonomous range of the Antikratos Protocols, we allow the Titan to take care of the lesser, more instinctive tasks, making the Junction more efficient
Flavor (Tech): Extended use of Reflex Priming leads some Titans to develop motor tics
Abilities: Unexhaust 2 @Gear cards among up to 2 Titans

Name: 13th Muse Grand Cannon
Flavor (Project): We once found a cannon with no name and hoped we never had to use it. Today we hope it still works
Abilities: <Start of Titan Round> You may choose an effect from the Payload card and roll a d10. On a 6+, the Cannon is primed. It remains primed until you fire, decide to prime a different effect, or the Battle ends.; Godkiller Shot:: When the Cannon is primed, discard 1 @Energy and lose the indicated resource to fire.; Emergency Priming:: As a @Reaction or after drawing a BP card you may discard 1 @Energy to perform an emergency priming. Immediately choose an effect from the Payload card and roll for priming as normal

Name: Transport Trireme
Flavor (Project): We know enough of the Great River Works canal network to use it to our advantage
Abilities: Rearm:: A Titan on, adjacent to, or moving through a space with the Trireme token may flip the Trireme token to the spent side to equip any 1 Support or Weapon @Gear card from the Armory. A spent Transport Trireme can still be moved as normal but loses the Rearm ability

Name: Ambrosia Containment
Flavor (Project): Even the Titans aren't immune to the corrupting effects of ambrosia. We need to support them however we can
Flavor (Tech): Specialized cleanup crews risk life and limb to minimize ambrosia exposure
Abilities: Choose a Titan that is about to gain Ambrosia tokens, lower this gain to 1

Name: Hephaestean Oxybeles
Flavor (Project): Though everyone talks about the 13th Muse, this oxybeles design can revolutionize the way we prepare for battle
Abilities: Choose a Weapon from the Armory. Then choose a Battle Board space you want to deploy the Weapon to and roll a d10:<<NL>>1-5: It lands 3 spaces away from the chosen space in a random direction.<<NL>>6-10: It lands on the chosen space. Mark this space with a generic token.<<NL>>A Titan on, adjacent to, or moving through the space with the token may discard it to equip the Weapon. If the Weapon lands on a space occupied by the Primordial, it remains stuck in its body. Place a generic token on the Primordial Sheet and place 2 Break tokens and 1 Opening token in the Kratos Pool. A Titan adjacent to the Primordial or on the Primordial VP may discard the generic token to equip the Weapon

Name: Hyperadrenaline Infusion
Flavor (Project): By stimulating the Titan's adrenal glands through the Junction, we can manufacture an incredible reflex reaction
Flavor (Tech): Is there a limit to the Titan's power?
Abilities: Choose a Titan that is about to perform a voluntary movement. That Titan may move 4 more spaces during this movement

Name: Pursuer Order
Flavor (Project): The study of the recovered cryptex has led to a breakthrough in Junction Theory
Flavor (Tech): The wings of oppression overturned now lift you up
Abilities: <Reaction> Choose a Titan. That Titan may move up to 2 spaces

Name: Rendezvous Trireme
Flavor (Project): You still remember that fateful rendezvous with the Symmachy. O strange bedfellows
Abilities: Housewarming Gift:: If you push the Primordial on to a space with the Trireme token, discard the token and place 1 negative @AT token in the Kratos Pool. If the Primordial moves through a space with the Trireme token, discard the token, then roll a d10. On a 6+, place 1 negative @AT token in the Kratos Pool

Name: Fate Converter
Flavor (Project): A Moirai verdict can be resisted, you have seen proof of that
Leads To: Hypertime Oracle Sighting, Icarian Harpy Sighting
Flavor (Tech): Weaponized free will
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan loses -2 @Fate and gains +1 @Danger

Name: Reverse Timeflow
Flavor (Project): Reverse-engineered reversed time
Leads To: Delphian Siren Armor, Delphian Siren Weapons, Hypertime Oracle Sighting
Flavor (Tech): Fast-tracked to victory
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan arrives from Time-clocked

Name: Possibility Matrix
Flavor (Project): The Oracle prunes possible outcomes, we need to multiply them
Leads To: Delphian Siren Armor, Delphian Siren Weapons, Icarian Harpy Sighting
Flavor (Tech): From the infinite pool of outcomes, survival requires just one
Abilities: Place the top card of any Trauma deck on the bottom of that deck. You may use this ability as a free action or as a @Reaction

Name: Telehealing
Flavor (Project): We know how to stimulate healing through the Junction, though we don't know how it works
Leads To: Hypertime Oracle Sighting, Icarian Harpy Sighting
Flavor (Tech): I see you, my children
Abilities: Discard up 2 to Bleeding tokens from a chosen Titan

Name: Transient Death
Flavor (Project): By bending the Delphian Loop, we can bring back a recently deceased Titan to life. For a price...
Flavor (Tech): Even death may die
Abilities: Lose -1 Titan from the _Argo_ to choose a dead Titan. That Titan comes back to life at their Time Anchor. You may use this ability as a free action or as a @Reaction

Name: Quantum Armory
Flavor (Project): Slightly shifting the timeline allows us to re-arm the Titans in the past
Flavor (Tech): For each task, the perfect tool
Abilities: Immediately equip 1 Weapon from the Argo Armory. You may swap it with one of your currently equipped Weapons (return it to the Argo Armory). You may use this ability as a free action or when you are about to perform a *Bonus Attack*

Name: Opportunity Freeze
Flavor (Project): Slowing down time to extend your window of opportunity
Flavor (Tech): Everyone deserves a second chance
Abilities: When a Titan fully misses an Attack, do not clear the Kratos Pool

Name: Chronosphere Warning System
Flavor (Project): Monitoring the flow of time grants Titans near precognitive reflexes
Requirements: Delphian Siren Armor, Delphian Siren Weapons
Leads To: Black Ice Armor, Atemporal Support Equipment
Flavor (Tech): Forecast: Survival
Abilities: @Reaction Choose a Titan. That Titan may move up to 3 spaces

Name: Time Skip
Flavor (Project): The study of the recovered cryptex has led to a breakthrough in Junction Theory
Flavor (Tech): --Dovahzul text--
Abilities: During a Titan turn, even after you have used both of your actions, choose a Titan. That Titan may imediately perform an additional @CombatAction

Name: Time Dilation
Flavor (Project): Slowing time inside the Junction
Flavor (Tech): --Dovahzul text--
Abilities: During a Titan turn, even after you have used both of your actions, choose a Titan. That Titan may imediately perform an additional @MovementAction

Name: Irem Protocols
Flavor (Project): Our scholars have broken the wish-codes used to hide the towers in the sand
Flavor (Tech): Action exigent: Emergy retraction
Abilities: Move an empty Irem Tower Terrain tile any number of spaces in a straight line. It cannot move through other Terrain tiles or the Primordial

Name: Wish Deflector
Flavor (Project): When properly calibrated, Delphian paracausal shielding can provide a brief respit from the barrage of wishes
Flavor (Tech): Wishing you did not have to wish
Abilities: When a Titan becomes the Target of a Wish Attack, choose that Titan. That Titan gains {Wish Armor}

Name: Gold Transmogrifier
Flavor (Project): This alchemical process is highly unstable but remains the fastest known converter
Flavor (Tech): Like a million tiny wishes
Abilities: Choose a Titan and roll 2 @BlackPowerDie. Count the number of @Power. Turn as many of that Titan's Midas tokens into Ambrosia tokens

Name: Archimedean Ballista
Flavor (Project): Next generation of weapons utilizing the devasting power of the Sun
Flavor (Tech): Not a ballista at all
Abilities: Place 3 Opening tokens or 2 Fire tokens in the Kratos Pool

Name: Cloud Support Fleet
Flavor (Project): Our enemies dominate the skies. We need to wrest air superiority away from them
Flavor (Tech): We have adapted the local "cirrotrireme" technology, though our cloud vessels remain inferior to the fleet of the Empire
Abilities: {Elevated}. Place the Cirrotrireme token or move the Cirrotrireme token to any space on the Battle Board (even if occupied); Rearm:: A Titan on, adjacent to, or moving through a space with the Cirrotrireme token may flip the token to the spent side to equip any 1 Weapon @Gear card from the Armory. A spent Cirrotrieme can still be moved as normal but loses the *Rearm* ability

Name: Dahaka Phasing
Flavor (Project): Dahaka's signature in the Triskelion is like a tempestuous wind or tide. If we could surf it...
Leads To: Insolvency Bulwark, Dahaka Autopsy, Midascore Autospy, Demidjinn Live Study
Flavor (Tech): Anemoi reflex
Abilities: @Reaction Choose a Titan. That Titan may perform {Hermes Move 1}

Name: Cloud Scout Fleet
Flavor (Project): We need to develop a lighter, faster method for reconnaissance and extraction
Flavor (Tech): Second generation cloudships, hemiolias of the skies
Abilities: Choose a Titan that is being Wished Away. Reduce that suffered Wish Away by up to -4. You may place that Titan on any Irem Tower within range (not necessarily in front of the Primordial)

Name: Ascension Protocols
Flavor (Project): The Babelian Lunacy is an ever-changing architectural impossibility. Maybe we should treat it like a current, not a structure?
Flavor (Tech): Insider shortcuts
Abilities: Choose a Titan performing an Ascent check. Add +3 to the result

Name: Curse Resistor
Flavor (Project): We need to undersatnd the underlying imbalance of the curses
Leads To: Demidjinn Autopsy, True Value of Life
Flavor (Tech): By dividing the curse between several willing participants simultaneously, we weaken its effects
Abilities: Choose a Titan. Either: $Energy Flip one of that Titan's Condition cards. $Energy $Energy Discard one of that Titan's Condition cards

Name: Ropeseller Theorem
Flavor (Project): Greed stronger than survival
Flavor (Tech): In the end, it defeats itself
Abilities: When the Primordial reveals an AI card or triggers a Signature that targets a specific Titan, change the Targeting to *Target:* Most Midas tokens

Name: Calculate Statistical Certainty
Flavor (Project): A wise and ancient advisor of unknown origin, brought into existence by the wonders of Mnestis. It always tells the truth, no matter how bleak it is
Leads To: Abyss Support, Oxygen Tubes, Ur-Fleece Sighting
Flavor (Tech): Chance of survival: bleak
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan uses the Truth Machine

Name: Kintsukuroi Pharos
Flavor (Project): This giant searchlight is an unexpected by-product of the Last Wish. This is the 13th Muse, reconstructed
Flavor (Tech): There is value in mending broken things
Abilities: <Start of Battle> Choose one Kintsukuroi Pharos Payload and place it on this card. Until the end of Battle, the Payload becomes the effect of this Argo Ability

Name: Oxygen Tubes
Flavor (Project): Made from Primordial intestines, they carry life-saving air from the Argo
Flavor (Tech): Time bought
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan flips 1 Aether token

Name: Drag It Back!
Flavor (Project): Giant harpoon guns mounted on the Argo itself
Flavor (Tech): Fire forward harpoons!
Abilities: The Titan closest to the Primordial immediately performs Pushback X or Pull X, where X is up to 3

Name: Underwater Support Fleet
Flavor (Project): A reclaimed Atlantean deepsea ship serves as the eyes and ears of the Titans
Flavor (Tech): A Galeos-class subreme, like the ones you use as harpoon tips...
Abilities: Place the Subreme token on any space adjacent to the Board Edge and move it up to 5 spaces, or if the Subreme is already on the Board, move it up to 5 spaces (even if occupied). A spent Subreme can still be moved as normal but loses the *Rearm* and *Detect* abilities.; Rearm:: A Titan on, adjacent to, or moving through the space with the Subreme token may flip the token to the spent side to equip any 1 Weapon card from the Armory or flip an Aether token.; Detect:: Flip the Subreme token to the spent side to perform a Scan

Name: Flash Backstep
Flavor (Project): You're still far from reaching the limits of cryptext tekne, though further gains will be paid by the pain of the subject
Leads To: Atlantean Weapons, Dragon of Phobos Autopsy, Meduketos Live Study, Silvered Armor, Triskelion Override, Titan X Investigation
Flavor (Tech): Is pain elation? Or are you projecting?
Abilities: Choose a Titan when an adjacent Primordial performs {Flash Step}, {Vanish}, or {Flicker}. Gain 1 Pain token to immediately move up to 9 spaces to remain adjacent

Name: Painkiller Shot
Flavor (Project): A remote Junction command that immediately shuts off the nerves of a Titan
Flavor (Tech): A new philosophical protocol allows us to "trick" a Titan's nervous system
Abilities: Choose a Titan. Either lower Pain and/or Bleed gain to 1, or ignore all Pain tokens this Round

Name: Triskelion Override
Flavor (Project): A jolt sent through the Junction will override any natural instinct
Flavor (Tech): Is pushing them this far worth it?
Abilities: Choose a Titan. Gain 3 Pain tokens to perform a @CombatAction or @MovementAction, then gain a @CombatAction or @MovementAction Fatigue token

Name: Inner Light
Flavor (Project): A solution of liquid orichalcum introduced into the bloodstream, to be triggered remotely
Flavor (Tech): Let there be light
Abilities: Choose a Titan that is about to die from [Disemboweled|AM0341], [Fear|AL0299], [Dread|AL0299], [Terror|EL2596], or [Holy Terror|EL2596]. That Titan draws a Grave Trauma instead

Name: Anchor Drop Pod
Flavor (Project): Special pods of reinforced materials designed for rapid submersion
Flavor (Tech): Prepare for Titan drop!
Abilities: If, during the first Primordial or Titan Round, a Titan dies, replace them with a new Titan from the Stoa. Choose a Battle Board space you want to Deply (see Cycle V, p. 11) the new Titan to and roll a d10:<<NL>>1-5: It lands 3 spaces away from the chosen space in a random direction.<<NL>>6-10: It lands on the chosen space.<<NL>>If it lands on the Primordial, place 2 Closing and 1 Hope tokens in the Kratos Pool and Deploy the Titan on any adjacent space

Name: Soulbalm
Flavor (Project): As we learn to create more nuanced Junction commands, we can speak to the Titan more directly
Flavor (Tech): Can you hear me? You are not alone in this
Abilities: Choose a Titan. That Titan discards all Despair tokens or a [Fear|AL0299] or [Terror|EL2596] Condition card
